author: palladia

comments.author: palladia
comments.body:
Tab completion seems to work for cmdlets, but it doesn't seem to work correctly for file names.
1.  If I <tab> without any letter, it cycles through all the possible files. However, if I cd to another directory, it still cycles through files from old directory, not current directory.
2. If I hit a letter and then <tab>, it does nothing.  No cycling of possible choices, or tries to complete the file.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
I was tempted to open a new issue, but I think it make sense to discuss other tab-completion problems here.

### Completion eats beginning of the line

```
PS> [psobject].Asse<Tab>
```

#### Expected

```
PS> [psobject].Assembly
```

#### Actual

```
PS> Assembly
```

## Completion doesn't work on a variable

```
PS> $a = [psobject]
PS> $a.Asse<Tab>
```

#### Expected

```
PS> $a.Assembly
```

#### Actual

```
PS> $a.Asse
```

Tested on 6d5194057ea55eccac00ef6566d9edc9b8862fc4 Ubuntu 14.04

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@palladia haha, so `#548` gets automatically linked to the issue, no need to add a link. Even cooler, `dotnet/corefx#123` will automatically link to the issue number 123 of the corefx repo of the dotnet team; no manual links required.

This now works on master, closing.

title: Tab-completion does not complete file names correctly
